meanings.definition: The act of interpreting or explaining something as an allegory.
meanings.sent1: Her allegorizations of the ancient fables helped the children understand the moral lessons.
meanings.sent2: The professor's allegorizations of the novel added depth to our understanding of the author's intentions.
meanings.sent3: The allegorizations of the fairy tale characters attending a modern-day school were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In her allegorizations, the forest represented the unknown journey of life, filled with twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The artist's allegorizations on canvas brought to life the hidden meanings behind everyday objects.

meanings.definition: The process of turning something into an allegory.
meanings.sent1: The allegorizations of historical events made them more relatable to the younger generation.
meanings.sent2: Through allegorizations, the author transformed the mundane into the extraordinary.
meanings.sent3: The allegorizations of the vegetables having a dance party in the fridge were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His allegorizations turned the simple act of gardening into a metaphor for personal growth.
meanings.sent5: The allegorizations in the play revealed deeper truths about human nature and society.
